metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26604 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
systemd before 247 does not adequately block local privilege escalation for some Sudo configurations, e.g., plausible sudoers files in which the "systemctl status" command may be executed. Specifically, systemd does not set LESSSECURE to 1, and thus other programs may be launched from the less program. This presents a substantial security risk when running systemctl from Sudo, because less executes as root when the terminal size is too small to show the complete systemctl output.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libnss-mymachines - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libnss-resolve - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libnss-systemd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libpam-systemd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libsystemd-shared - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libsystemd0 - 252.4-1ubuntu1
libudev1 - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-boot - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-boot-efi - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-container - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-coredump - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-homed - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-journal-remote - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-oomd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-resolved - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-sysv - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-tests - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-timesyncd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
systemd-userdbd - 252.4-1ubuntu1
udev - 252.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> on https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/5666 upstream claims this is not a vulnerability. upstream feature SYSTEMD_PAGERSECURE implemented in systemd version 247. mdeslaur> This is only an issue if an administrator configured systemctl access using sudo instead of using policykit, which is an unlikely scenario. Per Red Hat bug, systemctl commands that use the pager can run unprivileged. Setting priority to "low".

criterions.comment: systemd package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '252.4-1ubuntu1').
